definition: to formally become an apprentice to a master

sentences.english: He was apprenticed to a master silversmith.
sentences.chinese: 他跟銀匠師傅拜師學藝。

sentences.english: One day, the youth that came to wearing junk, do obeisance to division into the door.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，來了一個穿着破爛的年輕人，進門拜師。

sentences.english: In order to learn the skills, he is not afraid of hard, full of art.
sentences.chinese: 爲了學本領，他不怕艱苦，到處拜師學藝。

sentences.english: His father apprenticed him to a carpenter.
sentences.chinese: 他的父親使他向木匠拜師學藝。

sentences.english: It is the product of teaching practice reform for normal school students to learn skills from master teachers.
sentences.chinese: 師範生拜師學藝是實踐教學改革的產物。

sentences.english: One is away from home, to Chenjiagou study with a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 一個人離開了家，到陳家溝拜師學藝。

sentences.english: Benjamin was bred a silk dyer, serving an apprenticeship at London.
sentences.chinese: 本傑明是絲綢染匠，在倫敦拜師受業。

definition: to learn a skill or art
entrance door/to enter a door/introduction (to a subject)
used for 師傅|师傅 (in Taiwan)/master/qualified worker
senior male fellow student or apprentice/son (older than oneself) of one's teacher
to practice medicine (esp. in private practice)
master/qualified worker/respectful form of address for older men/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
study of the Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
